title: Search field is available on the vendor/establishment's list view page
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
custom_steps: WHEN a user is viewing the vendors/ establishments list
custom_expected: THEN, a search bar is visible on the top.

title: User is able to tap the search field
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the search bar
custom_expected: THEN, app blanks the search bar label and pushes up the keyboard so a user can enter search terms.

title: Suggestions are shown upon tapping the search field
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the search bar
custom_expected:
THEN, before a user enters any inputs, app displays the suggestion list below the search bar
AND a user can easily tap one of the suggested terms.

title: User taps a suggested terms
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
AND a user taps on the search bar
custom_steps:
WHEN a suggestion list populates below the search bar
AND a user taps on a suggested search term
custom_expected:
THEN, the app executes the search with the current location filter and displays results
AND on execution term should now appear in the search bar

title: Cancel button is visible when a user taps on the search field
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the search a bar
custom_expected:
THEN, a cancel button is displayed as search bar is focused
AND upon tapping "Cancel" button the search bar is expanded
AND Cancel button is hidden

title: User is able to clear or edit the search terms
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
AND a user taps on the search bar
custom_steps:
WHEN a user search any keyword
AND a user tap on search bar again
custom_expected: THEN, a user is able to clear or edit the search terms as populated

title: User is able to search food item by entering explicit name or description
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is on the vendors/ establishments list view
AND a user taps on the search bar
custom_steps: WHEN a user enters any explicit name/description of any food item (ex: Fries, hot dog, pizza etc...)
custom_expected: THEN, a user is able to quickly locate food item based upon the explicit name or a description entered in the search bar.

title: Dismissal of Search
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user has entered into the search modal
custom_steps: WHEN a user tap the inactive list area
custom_expected: THEN, a user is returned to the vendors/ establishments list without executing a search.

title: UX functionality during live filtering of search terms
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is in the search modal
AND a keyboard is displayed
custom_steps:
WHEN a user type in single character
AND a user type in 2 characters
AND as the user continues to type
AND if a user deletes all characters
custom_expected:
THEN, nothing happens and suggested terms still remain on screen
AND suggested search terms clear and vendors/ establishments start to appear that match
AND  vendors/ establishments live filter and results are narrowed down
AND in this state:
-A user can scroll and select
-Execute search
-On execution, the keyboard is dismissed
AND the suggested search terms appear again upon deleting all characters
AND a user can cancel out of search

title: Search during live filtering of search terms
custom_preconds: ASSUMING a user is in the search modal
custom_steps:
WHEN a user is typing
AND the search filter is returning vendors/ establishments
custom_expected:
THEN, a user is able to scroll the list
AND a user is able to tap on the establishment
AND a user is taken to that establishment's menu while the keyboard is still active

title: No results notification
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is in the search modal
custom_steps: WHEN a user enter in an accepted search term but no establishments met that requirement
custom_expected: THEN, a message should appear below the dropdown "Sorry, there are no mobile ordering locations available right now"

title: No results and modification
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is in the search modal
AND a user has executed a search
custom_steps: WHEN no establishments were found from an accepted executed search
custom_expected: THEN, a user can either enter a new search term or change set location, so a user can attempt to find an establishment.

title: User can input a descriptive keyword to find vendors/ establishments
custom_preconds: ASSUMING a user is in the search modal
custom_steps: WHEN a user enters a descriptive keyword to search for a vendor
custom_expected: THEN, a user is displayed with choices closely aligned to what the user has searched for.

title: Establishment unavailable notification
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is in the search modal
custom_steps: WHEN a user select an establishment and it is not available
custom_expected:
THEN, a single button dialog box is displayed letting the user know what has occurred
AND text states: "Sorry, mobile ordering is not available at the establishment right now."
AND tapping return to search button takes the user to browse view with that last active set of parameters.

title: User can filter vendor and establishment's based on location
custom_preconds: ASSUMING, a user is on the food vendor and establishment's list view page
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the Location drop down
custom_expected: THEN, a user can search/ filter vendors or establishments based on location selected around the park

title: Default location set to anywhere in national park
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user has Washington National selected as their team on the BallPark app
AND a user taps on Mobile ordering option for food ordering
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on start ordering food by location in the food ordering app
custom_expected: THEN, location is set to "Anywhere in national park" as default

title: User can narrow search by selecting Levels from the location dropdown
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is on the establishment list view page
AND a user taps on the location dropdown menu
AND a user taps on levels tab
AND a user select the level which they are currently seated in
custom_steps: WHEN a user taps on the search bar and search for an establishment
custom_expected: THEN, the search result would return establishment based on the level user has selected

title: User can narrow search by selecting sections from the location dropdown
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is on the establishment list view page
AND a user taps on the location dropdown menu
AND a user taps on sections tab
AND a user select the section which they are currently seated in
custom_steps: WHEN a user search for an establishment
custom_expected: THEN, the search result would return establishments only based on the section the user has selected.

title: User can narrow search by selecting landmarks from the location dropdown
custom_preconds:
ASSUMING, a user is on the establishment list view page
AND a user taps on the location dropdown menu
AND a user taps on landmarks tab
AND a user select the landmark which they are currently by
custom_steps: WHEN a user search for an establishment
custom_expected: THEN, the search result would only return establishment based on and around the landmark the user has selected.

title: User gets hit with ‘establishment is closed’ message when attempting to navigate to a closed establishment
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user is in the Browse Concessions screen
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps a venue that is closed
custom_expected:
THEN the user will get hit with the ‘establishment closed’ message
AND user is navigates back to the browse concessions screen
